oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shelby Avenue Church of Christ, 2001 March
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Shelby Avenue Church of Christ located at 1700 Shelby Avenue in the East Nashville neighborhood of Nashville, Tennessee. According to the cornerstone, the original building was erected in 1933, while the congregation was organized 1908. The church has a rock foundation and brick exterior walls. The roof is gabled. The windows are Palladian in style without wings. The doors are wooden. Special features include a pediment supported by four columns, a portico, and an old rock wall around the perimeter of the property. An addition to the building was completed in 1954 as indicated by a second cornerstone. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shelby Avenue Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.)
